definition: to read out/to recite/to remember sb (while talking about sth else)

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud

sentences.english: After we moved to the funeral parlour, we continued to chant into the night.
sentences.chinese: 在我们移灵殡仪馆之后，我们整夜为他念诵。

sentences.english: She asked the children to recite the Rosary for world peace and conversion of sinners.
sentences.chinese: 她要求他们念诵玫瑰经，为世界和平及罪人悔改。

sentences.english: Also in the presence of YangJian face recite a poem.
sentences.chinese: 还当着杨坚的面念诵一首诗词。

sentences.english: And who is this chanter inside?
sentences.chinese: 这个念诵者的内在是谁？

sentences.english: Specific incantations had to be uttered in exorcism.’1
sentences.chinese: 驱邪中必须念诵特别的咒语。

definition: to chant a magic spell/to recite incantations
one of the many names of Buddha
to read silently/to mouth (the words of a prayer etc)/to say to oneself/to contemplate inwardly
true statement/incantation (translates Sanskrit: dharani 陀羅尼|陀罗尼)
variant of 念念有詞|念念有词[nian4 nian4 you3 ci2]
Om Mani Padme Hum (Sanskrit), or Om Mani Peme Hung (Tibetan), the Avalokiteshvara mantra
pinyin: an3 ma5 ni2 ba1 mi1 hong1

definition: the six-syllable Sanskrit mantra of Avalokiteshvara bodhisattva (i.e. om mani padme hum)
